item.title: Tree stays need moving to help tree grow upright, 14th October
item.description:
The young tree is a replacement for the tree cut down last autumn. It was an important Winter habitat for immigrating starlings. I fear this young tree will soon be causing a danger if left to grow at a jaunty angle unchecked. Is there any chance you could encourage it to grow more upright? Many thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Branston Crescent, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead fox in garden, 14th October
item.description:
A fox has died in the garden. Per the website, it has been placed in a sealed bag at the front of the property, ready for collection.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albemarle Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Every day cyclists go through the red lights and pedestrians are in danger, 14th October
item.description:
I have been living on Borough High Street for over three years, and I often return home from work on the 133 bus, getting off at Union Street (Stop G). As I cross the intersection of Union Street and Borough High Street, as well as Newcomen Street, I consistently observe cyclists and e-scooter riders ignoring the red light and pedestrian signals. This behavior poses a significant danger to both motorists and pedestrians. A collision between a cyclist and a pedestrian can lead to severe injuries or even death. Furthermore, e-bikes and e-scooters can reach much higher speeds, increasing the risk for pedestrians. I am incredibly frustrated and anxious about crossing the road to get home safely.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Union Street, The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damaged street signage, 14th October
item.description:
The street signage for entrance of Dalrymple Close is damaged to vehicle crashing through it, needs to be repaired/replaced

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dalrymple Close, Southgate, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Metropolitan police officer breaking the law. Metropolitan police cycling up Well street middle of Road on one-way system Road.Nearly into oncoming vehicle. I stopped and let him pass but he should not be coming up one way road. Yes, the one-way system on Well Street also applies to cyclists, meaning it is illegal for them to go the wrong way unless a specific sign indicates an exception. While some one-way streets in London have been made two-way for cyclists, this is not standard and must be clearly marked with signage, which you would need to check for on Well Street. Hackney Council if you could Mark this better please for offices to understand., 14th October
item.description:
Officer need further training in highway code. Posing danger to oncoming vehicles.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Well Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
